definitions.definition: To incur a charge of; to require payment of a (specified) price.
definitions.example: It will cost you a lot of money to take a trip around the world.

definitions.definition: To cause something to be lost; to cause the expenditure or relinquishment of.
definitions.example: Trying to rescue the man from the burning building cost them their lives.

definitions.definition: To require to be borne or suffered; to cause.
To calculate or estimate a price.
definitions.example: I'd cost the repair work at a few thousand.

definitions.definition: Amount of money, time, etc. that is required or used.
definitions.example: The average cost of a new house is twice as much as it was 20 years ago.

definitions.definition: A negative consequence or loss that occurs or is required to occur.
definitions.example: Spending all your time working may earn you a lot of money at the cost of your health.

definitions.definition: Manner; way; means; available course; contrivance.
Quality; condition; property; value; worth; a wont or habit; disposition; nature; kind; characteristic.
